page.title: 11Ladock Parish Hall
page.content: The Parish hall,a wooden building,was a ward at St.Clements hospital in the first world war. In 1926 Canon Flint bought the building and it was moved to church land by the river. Every Wednesday morning there is a painting class,Wednesday evening is Mrs. Sperry's dog training class. Friday night is Youth Club.Every 2nd Thursday in the month the Women's Institute have their meetings. Birthday parties, weddings or discos are at weekends. All the village societies hold Autumn and Spring fairs in the hall. In the summer the school has a carwash. The Parish Council holds their meetings in the hall and it is a polling station at elections. Once the Duke of Gloucester visited the Youth Club and once Bill Owen came. At the Queen's Silver Jubilee we had a village party and the children were given cups.
